result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arlie J. Balthazor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court calls 16CM211 & 16CM121  @ 11:39 am.  Defendant Arlie J. Balthazor in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives plea agreement, 16CM211 plea to ct 1 & Ct 2, Ct 3, DRI Ct 4, 16CM121 DRI, 16CM211 ct 1 imposed & stay 90 days jail, 18 months probation, costs, DNA Surcharge, conditions,Absolute Sobriety,  No weapons,  no violent or abusive contact with D.H.  Domestic abuse counseling, ct 2 150 jail consecutive, imposed and stayed 18 months probation, costs, ct 3 90 days jail concurrent, imposed and stayed 18 months probation, costs.  Comply with victim rights and victim is in courtroom.  Atty Laufenberg and def. agree with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges and penalites.  Ct 1 D.C. with weapon, Domestic, no contest plea, ct 2 Battery, Domestic, no contest plea, ct 3 Bailjumping, no contest, Court grants DRI in ct 4 and 16CM121. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Laufenberg is satisfied.  Court finds plea are freely & voluntarily given. Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct 1 D.C. with weapon, Domestic, ct 2 Battery, Domestic, ct 3 Bailjumping.  State gives sentencing recommendation. State advises victim does not wish to speak. Atty Laufenberg gives sentencing recommendation. Nothing by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. 
ct 1 90 days jail, imposed and stay 18 months probation, huber if serves jail, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge and sample, Absolute Sobriety,  No weapons,  no violent or abusive contact with D.H.  Domestic abuse counseling as required, no use or possession of controlled substances illegally, 4 days credit if revoked.
ct 2 150 days jail, imposed and stayed, consecutive to 90 days, 18 months probation, concurrent to ct 1, costs, DNA surcharge, same conditions, no credit if revoked. Jail is with huber.
ct 3 90 days jail w/huber, concurrent, imposed and stayed, 18 months probation, concurrent, costs, DNA surcharge, same conditions, 4 days credit if revoked. 
Return bond to poster. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Postconviction rights.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CM121 & 16CM211 @ 9:59 am. Atty Laufenberg would like set for plea & sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Arlie J. Balthazor in court with attorney Wright Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CM211 and 16CM121  @ 11:21 am.  Atty Laufenberg has copy of complaint in 16CM211, waives reading, reserve rights and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty pleas in 16CM211. Bond remains in 16CM211 with conditions.  16CM121 to follow.  Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Arlie J. Balthazor in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews court record.  Complaint received and waive reading.  Special appearance.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will accept plea.  bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Arlie J. Balthazor in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews court record.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reviews charge with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  Def can contact public defender, hire an atty or court appointed atty.  Def can proceed on his own, make an appt. with district atty's office.  Def wishes to hire an atty. Bond has been set and will continue  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Arlie J. Balthazor in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has receive notice from victim to lift no contact provision.  Court will remove the no contact provision.
